entry.title: Debugging AppleScript: Print to a File
entry.content:
Debugging AppleScript is easy when you work with the script editor, simply use `log` to print out anything in the console. However, after you compiled it to an app, this cannot work anymore.
I find there are several ways to do it in this [thread](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2749863/applescript-editor-write-message-to-the-result-window). The [two approaches](http://stackoverflow.com/a/21309748/577704) that work best for me are:
<!-- more -->
1. Use `logger` to log to the syslog. E.g.,
``` applescript do shell script "logger -t 'AS DEBUG' " & myObj ```
However, I don't know why sometimes this is not logged. So I will use the following:
2. Echo to file
``` applescript do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (myObj as string) & Â¬ " >> ~/Desktop/as_debug.txt" ```
